know how to evoke the diagnosis of a fracture without excessive manipulation of the limb, know how to immediately prescribe temporary immobilisation, know how to prescribe a level 2 or 3 painkiller in children, know how to locate the lesion and prescribe imaging targeted at the region concerned.

question.question: When managing childhood trauma and suspecting a fracture, what is the most appropriate initial step?
question.option_a: Immediately performing a detailed physical examination of the entire limb to locate the lesion
question.option_b: Prescribing a level 1 painkiller and waiting for the pain to subside before any further action
question.option_c: Evoking the diagnosis of a fracture without excessive manipulation of the limb and prescribing temporary immobilization
question.option_d: Ordering a full-body scan to identify any potential fractures
